original_solution_mapping.L1: If Kameron has 100 kangaroos, he has 100-20= <<100-20=80>>80 more kangaroos than Bert.
original_solution_mapping.L2: Buying 2 kangaroos every day, it will take Bert 80/2=40 days to have the same number of kangaroos as Kameron has now.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 1852.
    Returns: the number of days it will take Bert to have the same number of kangaroos as Kameron.
    """
    # L1
    kameron_kangaroos = 100 # Kameron has 100 kangaroos
    bert_kangaroos = 20 # Bert has 20 kangaroos
    difference_kangaroos = kameron_kangaroos - bert_kangaroos

    # L2
    daily_purchase_rate = 2 # rate of 2 new kangaroos per day
    days_to_match = difference_kangaroos / daily_purchase_rate

    # FA
    answer = days_to_match
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: If Kameron has {kameron_kangaroos} kangaroos, he has {kameron_kangaroos}-{bert_kangaroos}= <<{kameron_kangaroos}-{bert_kangaroos}={difference_kangaroos}>>{difference_kangaroos} more kangaroos than Bert.
Buying {daily_purchase_rate} kangaroos every day, it will take Bert {difference_kangaroos}/{daily_purchase_rate}={days_to_match} days to have the same number of kangaroos as Kameron has now.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: If Kameron has 100 kangaroos, he has 100-20= <<100-20=80>>80 more kangaroos than Bert.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Buying 2 kangaroos every day, it will take Bert 2/2=1 days to have the same number of kangaroos as Kameron has now.

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'daily_purchase_rate' (value: 2) was used instead of 'difference_kangaroos' (value: 80).
